title: CapabilityFile
description: Capability formats accepted in a capability file.

Capability.description:
a grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to separate windows or plugins functionality from each other at runtime.

If a window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.

This can be done to create trust groups and reduce impact of vulnerabilities in certain plugins or windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name or glob patterns like *, admin-* or main-window.

context.description:
Execution context of the capability.

At runtime, Tauri filters the IPC command together with the context to determine wheter it is allowed or not and its scope.

permissions.description: List of permissions attached to this capability. Must include the plugin name as prefix in the form of `${plugin-name}:${permission-name}`.

platforms.description: Target platforms this capability applies. By default all platforms applies.

windows.description: List of windows that uses this capability. Can be a glob pattern.

oneOf.description: Capability refers to local URL usage.
Capability refers to remote usage.

domains.description: Remote domains this capability refers to. Can use glob patterns.
